author: Chris Davie
title: Jurgen Klopp urged to not sign Mario Gotze for Liverpool
text:
Mario Gotze is reportedly wanted by Liverpool this summer. (TF-Images/Getty Images) Jurgen Klopp should not make the signing of Mario Gotze a priority for Liverpool, according to former Chelsea and Celtic midfielder Craig Burley.
Last week, reports claimed that Liverpool had opened talks over a £20 million deal for the Germany international.
Gotze was a key part of Klopp’s Dortmund side as the pair won consecutive Bundesliga titles together in 2011 and 2012.
‘This is a difficult one,’ Burley told ESPN.
Gotze won two Bundesliga titles with Klopp at Dortmund. (Bongarts/Getty Images) More: Football Antoine Griezmann breaks silence over Manchester United transfer speculation

‘I think with [Sadio] Mane, Coutinho, [Roberto] Firmino, are Liverpool going to squeeze him in or put [another player] on the bench?
‘This is not a priority for Liverpool. I’m going to say [it won’t happen] but not because I don’t like the player.
‘If he’s a replacement then possibly, but not just to come in and dump one of their other players to the bench.’
